# Jimmy Sullivan (Queensland politician)

James Anthony Sullivan (born 5 January 1982) is an Australian politician who has served as the member for Stafford in the Queensland Legislative Assembly since 2020.
Sullivan was promoted to Assistant Minister for Justice and Veterans' Affairs by then-premier Steven Miles after the 2023 Queensland Labor Party leadership election. He served in this position until the state election on 26 October 2024.
He is the son of Terry Sullivan who also served as the member for Stafford from 2001 to 2006.
Sullivan was re-elected as the member for Stafford on a 55.3% two party preferred vote, albeit suffering a 6.6% swing to his challenger Fiona Hammond, long serving councillor for the Marchant Ward.
Media reports began to emerge shortly after the election of the Queensland Police Service attending to the member of Stafford's Kedron address the day after the October state election due to an alleged domestic incident.
On 12 May 2025, Sullivan was expelled from the Labor Party caucus. He now sits in Parliament as an independent.
